debutant.nom: Contact the ball low to the table
debutant.description: Ideally at about net height. The higher the contact point the higher the ball will tend to bounce.

debutant.nom: Barely graze the ball when serving
debutant.description: Especially when serving short with spin. The more you graze the ball, the more energy goes into spin instead of speed, giving the ball a lower bounce.

debutant.nom: Think of serving as a struggle to get the ball over the net
debutant.description: Instead of trying to lower your serve, think of having to raise your serve so that it barely goes over the net.

exercices_complementaires.nom: Practice serving low and short with spin
exercices_complementaires.description: The more you practice, the better you'll get at getting your serves to bounce low on the far side.

erreurs_a_eviter: Don't think of it as serving low, think of it as a struggle to get the ball over the net.
